title: Ranan
detailsOfAchievement: Ranan is a young performance company on an exciting journey of discoveryâ€”a journey powered with the electric joy, the fascinating ephemerality, the inspired and inspiring moments of live performance. Ranan Performance Collective grew out of an immediate felt need to demystify Indian classical dance and make it accessible and enjoyable for larger audiences. The vision has grown into a conviction that performing arts should be an indispensable part of life both for those who practice it and those who partake of it. We aim to explore and forge imaginative, practical and accessible ways of bringing art, artists and audiences closer together so that the arts themselves can thrive and evolve by involving more and more people. Ranan works in three broad areas * Productions * Performance Training * Partnership Projects. PRODUCTIONS Ranan production work straddles two categories â€“ Dance, always with Kathak at the centre of a variety of impulses Theatre, with dance and movement as an integral and powerful component Rananâ€™s performances have earned a reputation for variety and quality, featuring at venues as varied as theatre and dance events, performance festivals, corporate gatherings, and fest at institutes of higher education. PERFORMANCE TRAINING Rananâ€™s Kathak training wing â€“ Brindar â€“ conducts regular classes and is also committed to providing exposure to other languages of movement and performance techniques through a range of workshops, interactions and screenings. Rananâ€™s own rehearsal space â€“ a luxury for performance groups in India â€“ allows simultaneously flexible and intensive inputs of time and planning for the purpose of training. PARTNERSHIP PROJECTS Ranan works in partnership with various organisations on a range of projects â€“ workshops, interactive sessions, radio programmes, platforms, lecture demonstrations and more.

detailsOfAchievement: Rangaloke founded in 8th January 1972. Propagating cultural and social awareness through theatre and performing art is the main objective of the group. The major activities of the troupe is listed as under a. producing plays regularly, both short length and full fledged. b. Participating in various State level play festival. c. Organising theatre workshops on several aspects of performing arts d. felicitating theatre personalities e. Publishing yearly cultural magazine Some renowned plays that have been produced by the troupe are, Eskaboner Golam, Chalachitta Chanchari, Joy Baba Hanunath, Eka Nay, Saradiyo Shahazahan, Agnigarva Lena, Dahan, Antesti, Parash Pathar, Shekal Chhenra Hater Khonje, Samanya Khati, Bhusandir Mathe and many others. The troupe has earned many awards and honours in the cultural fields. Theatre personalities like Bibhas Chakraborty, Arun Mukherjee, Ashoke Mukherjee, Kamal Saha and others were felicitated by the group in different occasions. As a troupe registered under Society Registration Act 1961, it has regularly been satisfy the legal obligations successfully to get renewal in every year under the said Society Act.

title: Rangapat
detailsOfAchievement: Rangapat started working since early 2004. We have 11Theatre Productions like Jyotsnar Kathamala, Sonar Chabi, Chokhe Angul Dada, Parabas, Tusher Agun, Aurangzeb & Jhum-jhumi, Muktadhara, Tathagata, Dharmashok and preparation for the 11th production Krishna Paksha is underway. Besides, The group is continuously bringing out its Annual Theatre Magazine, Rangapat Natyapatra, 11 issues so far,12th issue is on the process valuable and voluminous, contained with research works on legendry playwrights, Paintings, plays, articles and theatre news. We have started Theatre School, Mohit Natya Vidylaya, in 2012 in memory of Mohit Chattapadhyaya, to generate interest and enthusiasm about Theatre and to propagate academics and applications of Theatre amongst the Theatre internees. We organised a handful of Theatre festivals like 75th Birth Aniversary celebration of Sri Mohit Chattopadhyay, Debsankar Natya Mela, Restrospective Theatre festival on Sri Harimadhab Mukhopadhyay, Moner Majhe Mohit, O Alor Pathajatri. We offer 5 Award and Felicitations every year for Best theatre production, Best playwright, Lifetime Theatre achievement, Eminent backstage activist and Most promising theatre internee. We run projects, in the name of Theatorch in the schools for motivating children towards theatre since 2010. We offer social aids to the people and Theatre activists in distress on different occassions. We also organise Seminar, Workshop, Playwriting competetions throughout the year to enlighten ourselves and to promote theatre activities.

detailsOfAchievement: In the year 1995, at Berhampore, a new name came up in the theatre world â€˜RANGASRAMâ€™. Rangasram was established with a noble motto to build up actors, actress and directors in Berhampore, which is such a small town where the cultural infrastructure is very poor and in Berhampore there was no such Institution where proper and scientific lessons were given for theatre. From this need of providing proper and scientific method of theatre, for the theatre workers, Rangasram was established, where many brilliant and efficient directors tried their level best to do something for theatre and to provide some proper scientific lesson to the theatre workers. Under guidance of some scholars and N.S.D pass out directors like, Siddhartha Chakroborty, Partha Banerjee, Sandip Bhattacharya. Rangasram has produced some brilliant productions, like Bijan Bhattacharyaâ€™s Garvabati Janani, Uru Bhangam, and Madhyanya Surya, â€˜Mobarakâ€™ an adaptation of Shakeapeareâ€™s Macbeth, Monideepaâ€™ which has received five best awards in Kolkata, â€˜Lohar Daamâ€™, â€˜Nayan Kobirer Palaâ€™ etc. In the year 2004-05 it was handed over to Mr. Sandip Bhattacharya. Rangasram is working with efficient theatre workers under the leadership of Sandip Bhattacharya, who is a pass out of National School of Drama in 1994. Rangasram traveled and taken part in prestigious festivals with the productions in various places in India, like Hyderabad, Delhi, Kolkata, Coochbihar etc. Rangasram â€˜s new play â€˜Monideepaâ€™ has achieved 5 best awards in kolkata, also has taken part in Bharat Rang Mahotsav organized by National School of Drama, New Delhi.

title: Renaissance
actName: Certi. of reg. of societies wb act xxvi of 1961
detailsOfAchievement: Renaissance,a group theatre organization, was founded in the year 1971.This was the time when Kolkata was very much turbulent due to political cross current.In that period Renaissance took up its journey for good theatres with about 15 enthusiastic youth. Till then it continued.The leadership changed but the very spirit remained. Formally Renaissance started its journey with Bengali theatre,mainly one act plays meant mainly for the Competition Theatre Festival,popular at that time. At least 45 plays were enacted at that time. Most of the plays were credited high for the production, acting and the choice of the plays. From 1996, a change is seen in its work pattern. At that year Renaissance organized a Theatre Workshop with the theatre loving people engaged in odd jobs, like Carpenter, Electrician, etc. All of them were inhabitants of the locality. The theatre workshop culminated in the production of a play Charandas MLA, based on the short story of famous Bengal Writer, Satinath Bhaduri. It was staged on 14 th July, 1996. As the inhabitants of the locality are Hindi speaking, so the play was produced in Hindi. It was a nice play and the actors enjoyed the play very much. And at their own initiative, they staged another production, Ramlila. It was a drama of 30 mins only, but with high skill. Till then Renaissance is producing Hindi plays except one Bengali one act and a full length drama. In that period Renaissance has produced, Umeed , Nabaabnama , Karnkatha, Dastak, Gardish, Kaal Kotri, Paanch Parameswar. Baal Bhawan a play of Swadesh Dipak is in the production process and will be staged in the month of February, 2010. Besides Production and performances of the plays, Renaissance has initiated Theatre education amongst the school children of the Hindi speaking Schools in a project entitled Theatre in Education with the Financial Assistance from the Ministry of HRD. It has also taken up the challenge of Imparting Mobility through Theatre with the Differently Able, Deaf and Dumb, students. It has also started theatre education with the children of the Slums, in association with the Civic bodies of the adjacent slums, to aware on the National Integration.

Shibsankar fought for the freedom of his mother land, suffered in jail for years and in his life time became a legendary figure through his social, humanitarian and philanthropic services to the people in distress. To carry forward the glorious heritage that he left before us, Saheed Shibsankar Seba Samity has its foundation on May 23, 1978. Objects: SSSS is not another hospital or a V.O where curative health care is usually offered to ailing people. It is an institution where preventive health awareness actions are encouraged, health education is offered with a view to make people conscious about healthy living. That is why SSSS is striving to evolve all the constituents of a comprehensive health care delivery where the main emphasis is on unleashing popular initiative for social action. It also attempts to act as an inter-face-agency between the ailing people and the curative centers. The meager curative services SSSS provides help also to develop a bondage with the people in distress. The preventive health programs that SSSS adheres to are basically a three way scheme-(i) Early Detection of illness in a particular community and Identification of the underlying causes (ii) Immunization against some recognized diseases which take a great toll of life and (iii) Health Education. SSSS Strives to: Assist and Co-operate with the Central and State Govt. in all its health care efforts: ïƒ˜ Provide minimum curative services to the ailing people. ïƒ˜ Organize awareness campaign on AIDS, TB, Thalassaemia , Cancer, Blindness control ïƒ˜ Running a NACO Assisted Licensed Blood Bank as per rules and specifications to provide safe blood to the needy. ïƒ˜ Running MNGO Scheme in Burdwan District under RCH-II to provide Mother& Child care program in the remote rural areas. ïƒ˜ Awareness campaign, identifying causes of common diseases like malaria, encephalitis, gastro-enteritis , Dengue, Viral Hepatitis, Bird flu, Swine flu & other viral diseases , Leprosy ïƒ˜ Organize seminars, workshops with help of posters, models, LCD projectors, OHP, on air and water pollution, safe drinking water, sanitation, nutrition, drug addiction, personal & area cleanliness, healthy habits, against superstition & promotion of scientific attitudes. ïƒ˜ Organize Health checkup Camps for Primary, Nursery & Adolescents girls in secondary schools. SSSS with its limited infrastructure provides: â€¢ OPD with general medicine, G&O, Pediatrics, Cardiology, Dermatology, Nephrology, Neurology, Chest, Surgery, Orthopedics, Dental, E.N.T & Eye in different days of the week. Poorer section is provided with free medicine for 3 days. â€¢ Well equipped laboratory with all types of pathology, Histopathology, Biochemical tests at a moderate cost. â€¢ Ambulance Service, Physiotherapy, E.C.G at affordable cost. â€¢ Publish a quarterly journal on health related problems, scientific awareness â€¢ Running a public library with more than 8500 books & journals to cater the need of all cross section of people.

detailsOfAchievement: FOCUSSED AREA OF DRISHTI ïƒ˜ EARLY INTERVENTION ïƒ˜ PARENT COUNSELING ïƒ˜ BEHAVIOR TRAINING ïƒ˜ EDUCATIONAL ASSESSMENT ïƒ˜ ANNUAL EVALUATION WITH REVIEW ïƒ˜ FUNCTIONAL TRAINING ïƒ˜ HOME BASED TRAINING TO DISTANT STUDENTS & SEVERE CASES. ïƒ˜ SELF HELP OTHER SERVICES ïƒ˜ COMMUNITY TRAINING THROUGH TOURS & FAIRS ïƒ˜ ODER AASHA SELF HELP UNIT TO GENERATE INCOME ïƒ˜ RECREATION EVENTS TO BRING JOY TO LIFE EDUCATIONAL ASSESSMENT An educational assessment mainly is helpful for monitoring the areas of learning like: WRITING COUNTING JOININIG TRACEING POINTING MATCHING And various other skills relating to COGNITIVE DEVELOPMENT, PERCEPTION, COMMUNICATION, VISUALDISCRIMINATION, MOTOR DEVELOPMENT ETC. AND FOR SURVIVAL EDUCATION (LANGUAGE, MATHS, and G.K.) HOME BASED TRAINING WITH PROGRAMME Dishti offers home based training to children with M.R. and other special children because Drishti realizes the parentâ€™s difficulty to bring such children in regular basis to any centre as on the way the parents face hazards bringing them in public transport specially. Drishti never looks down upon severe and profound children instead provide home basedguidance looking into parents comfort. Apart from this if any guardians/parents require Home Guidance,Drishti is ready to reach to such parents in and outside of Kolkata. Drishti has served such children at distant places like â€“ Darjeeling, Bankura, Medinipur, various districts of West Bengal, in order to help families having challenged children. Drishti never hesitated for money. Drishti considers service is above money. COMMUNITY AWARENESS Drishti from the very start has observed Valentineâ€™s Day, 15th August, Disability Day and other special days of our calendar in the past years and it was followed by media coverage as a step to reach to the mass with the message that challenged kids & adult needs participation and involvement in such days and they are not away from our community. They seek Love and affection too on Valentineâ€™s Day after Saint Valentine. Drishtiâ€™s each year arranges party on this day for them to enjoy their living in the community. Our message is LOVE THEM THEY ARE PART OF GOD â€˜S CREATION. Through Annual Tour challenged came to light during and during their stay in the various places Drishti by Godâ€™s grace met many good people like Shyamada of JAIRAMBATI , SwagataTalukdar, the hotel manager of Balaka(Bokkhali), the hotel manager of Nilima at Jairambati. Many common pupils were aroused to see such children at tour. They not only came to know about these children but they wanted to serve whenever required. Even the travel agencies were aroused and cooperated to their very best. West Bengal State Transport took Drishtichildren to Bakkhali. They provided several halts for on the way for their toileting needs. Here we are proud and blessed to have humble help provided by Sri Pavan Das a parent.It is nothing but a blessing to Drishtiâ€™s attempt. We are indebted to parents like Mr.Dutta, P.Raza ,S.Das and other parents to be beside community awareness programs of Drishti. SELF HELP UNIT The self help unit ODER AASHA clearly aims to seek an answer to their right to earn in future life after 18years. Every year Drishtiinvests rupees 5000/- for raw materials required for DIYA sale after puja. Drishti sincerely distributes the profit amount among the children equally who participated in production. Drishti believes every individual has a right to earn and contribute to the community and these children deserve same. Drishti has seen the sparkle in the eyes of the children when the money was distributed. The happiness was immense and canâ€™t be measured. JOY OF LIFE Life is a balance of work and fun. Thus Drishti feels birthday of every child should be observed. During sessions of training often dance and music is allowed at Drishti twice every month for arousal and amusement. Valentineâ€™s Day through media coverage has enlightened many friends in the locality No other day could have been better to spread this message. Drishti arranges picnics to places like â€“ Kolaghat,Rajarhat just to provide joy to parents and children. OUR FUTURE PLANS ï¶ A weekly club for children to enjoy games, magic show, music movies etc. ï¶ A shop or outlet in the heart of Kolkata, having branches other district of West Bengal engaged in selling only articles made by such children. ï¶ A Home for such children providing individual rooms to children with modern facilities and Individually Tailored. A well organize home is will bring peace to parents. ï¶ Drishti has a unique dream to involve children in and outside Drishti who are above 18 which Drishti feels will raise their self esteem and also Drishti considers their VOCATIONAL training will be fruitful when it will be applied in real life. These children are too man power of India if guided effectively. OUR ACHIVEMENTS DOCUMENTARY The first documentary the shots on 2010 directed by Sri SabyasachiBhowmik a young director. It was produced by Drishti the documentary covered mainly types of disability. Drishti deals with. The film was shown at the first short film festival at the Bangla Academy. The film festival started with â€œDIFFERENT SOULS "as the first film of the festival. Later in the year 2016 â€œCHALK "a documentary was directed by Deep Ghosh. The Documentary focused on the rare qualities of this challenged children. Drishti took the effort for film for film a step was awareness. RAMP SHOW Drishti by grace of God was invited at Park Street, where M.R. walked on Ramp. Drishti is always ready to any venture with these children. Drishti believes that it is duty of special school to guide and assist them to participate in any public show. This will helping mass awareness and also increase their self esteem. CLUB OPENING (LOY) Drishti by the grace of God met Nupr Gupta and Swati â€¦â€¦â€¦ who allowed and provided assistance at her residence to officially inaugurated the club â€œLOYâ€ in 2016 but due to lack of fun. This dream could not be executed in reality later. Drishti hopes someday Drishti will get some fund to rent a place to run the club effectively. The club will be exclusively for pupil (M.R and other special pupil) 18 years and above. The aim of the club is refreshment of these pupils who are debarred of basic right to weekend recreation like any other adult.

detailsOfAchievement: Sapphire Creations is Eastern Indiaâ€™s only experimental dance company striving to develop an organic, radical, dynamic and alternative idiom of movement. With a forte for innovation the ensemble is fresh, young and exudes a ready awareness of contemporary global concerns. Sapphire has performed with a new idiom for the last 18 years across 5 continents in various prestigious art festivals and conferences all over the world namely Malaysia, Canada, Australia, Thailand, Italy, Singapore, Sri Lanka, Poland, Bangladesh, United States, Austria, Spain and India. Sapphireâ€™s work approaches issues of gender, art, relationships, society, polity, consumerism and HIV through a global perspective, South Asian sensitivity and an experimental body stylistic. The Sapphire experiment imbibes ancient Indian body history to relevant modern contact and improvisatory solo and group work methods presenting itself as proscenium, site-specific, improvisatory, installations, multimedia work. Beyond dance Sapphire thrusts on community building for prevention and awareness of HIV/AIDS, promotion of contemporary arts, and dance therapy for different communities. The LINK THE ARTS movement with its sub-initiatives like InArtSync for campus mobilization, Sapphire Quarterly Arts Series to promote new contemporary idioms and spaces and the biennial international alternative arts festival INTERFACE now due for its 6th edition in 2012 are some of the consistent efforts by Sapphire to create a niche for the contemporary arts in India. Currently Sapphire has both School and Repertory sections. detailsOfAchievement: SAMARITANS ASSEMBLY works mainly with the people living in slums of the Borough for their basic needs and rights. So far it is a self-financed organization drawing support from individual donors. It is associated with the programs like education, health, women rights and organizes events for building awareness. It recently started working with the people of similar socioeconomic background from nearby area of Maheshtala Municipality. The organization runs non-formal education centers at Dock Junction, Brace Bridge and Khalbari just beside the Kolkata Dock & Port Area, which is one of the highly congested and densely populated slums of Kolkata and one centre in Solobigha community in Maheshtala Municipality. The children of the slums under the age group of 6-14 are benefitted from these centers and are getting into mainstream schools. The total 212 children are attending these centers and 4 (four) trained and dedicated teachers are guiding them and in which 3 teachers are dedicating their time honorary. The children after completion of the course in these centers get into mainstream schools to continue their formal education. We are also in the process of follow up so that there are not jump down of the school again. Samaritans Assembly also run a backup support centre for those who found week in study and do not have study space at their home and by this innovative idea the week children has upgraded the education status in their school. We have arranged educational kits for the 84 (eighty four) mainstreamed children from our beloved well-wisher Lioness Club. The organization runs regular health check-up camps for the children where doctor examine on a regular basis and the children who are found to have problems like lack of vitamins calcium, skin disease, abdomen pain, ENT, worm, sight problems etc. are treated. Necessary cases were referred to the Govt. hospital for further treatment. During the check- up medicines were provided. Doctors are also taking sessions on health and hygiene in the community with the children and their families. We would like to add here that check-up of children in each centre could not be organized due to financial crunch during the year. An energetic group of women is the pillar of Samaritans Assembly who is playing the vital role in its program. With the help from the organization they are spreading the importance of children education, women empowerment and stopping violence against women. They meet from time to time and discuss on the issues like nutrition education, health & hygiene, birth control, thrift policy, rights violation against women etc. Samaritans Assembly arranges expert support to reduce their violation of basic rights. Indoor and Outdoor activities with children, Excursion and Sport Meet on Annual Basis. Children Day, Independence Day, Teachers Day are being observed for the all round development.

detailsOfAchievement: With a view to having an incessant search for the roots underlying all ills of society and nation a band of young theatre activists comprising of Tapati Munshi,Swapan Ghosh,Chandan Chakraborty,Late Samir Dasgupta,Anilbandhu Banerjee,Late Rabin Das,Late Kalidas Dey,Ashoke Saha and Pankaj Munshi founded a drama group named Samikshan on 22.11.1978.Samikshan started its journey with Swadeshi Naksha a play by renowned playwright Mohit Chattopadhyay.Samikshan during this long journey of 31 years has produced 16 plays of some renowned playwrights to put an indelible mark in the history of bengali theatre which are Swadeshi Naksha,Kanamachhikhela,Abu Hossain,Totaram,Mrichchhakatika,Lobhendra Gabendra,Guhachitra,Antaral,Swapna Ujan,Kaler Yatra,Manmoyee Girls School,Anya Bhuban,Ekeiki bale Sabhyata,Bhoot,Punarjanma and Bidhatapurush.Samikshan has also risen to any social call and participated in many educational programme relating either to theatre or to any social cause.We have also been invited to many theatre festivals not only in bengal but also beyond our state geograohy in different cities of India to entertain innumerable audience.During this gracious and introspective presence in indian theatre fraternity Samikshan has not only been showered with unabashed love of uncountable welwishers but also been bestowed with many honors and awards like Dishari award for best production and abhinoy puroskar for best actor(Pankaj Munshi)in1979 for Swadeshi Naksha,Govt of West Bengal award for best director(Pankaj Munshi) and Writwik Ghatak Smriti puroskarfor best production in 1986 for Totaram(so far staged for more than 310shows),Writwik Ghatak Smriti puroskar for best director(Pankaj Munshi)in 1990 for Mrichchhakatika,best production and best actress (Manasi Sinha) award by Pashchimbanga Natya Academy of Govt of West Bengal in 2000 for Swapna Ujan.A true drama for children amusement is getting shape in our mind and is in the pipeline.
